content.formatted_body:
Hey; I've got a bug which essentially boils down to this little test case

class A {
    #x = "hello";
    constructor(o = this.#x) {
        this.value = o;
    }
};

var a = new A;
// Does new A throw? if not, does a.value have the value of `hello`?

org.matrix.msc1767.message.body:
Hey; I've got a bug which essentially boils down to this little test case

class A {
    #x = "hello";
    constructor(o = this.#x) {
        this.value = o;
    }
};

var a = new A;
// Does new A throw? if not, does a.value have the value of `hello`?

content.body: I'm trying to figure out what the spec says and got a little confused
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: I'm trying to figure out what the spec says and got a little confused

content.body: https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-evaluatenew says that ArgumentListEvaluation happens before the constructor is invoked; but AFAICT it's the constructor that actually allocates the object...
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: https://tc39.es/ecma262/#sec-evaluatenew says that ArgumentListEvaluation happens before the constructor is invoked; but AFAICT it's the constructor that actually allocates the object...

content.body: does ArgumentListEvaluation not actually... evaluate the arguments? ie, is the processing of the default argument deferred until later?
content.org.matrix.msc1767.text: does ArgumentListEvaluation not actually... evaluate the arguments? ie, is the processing of the default argument deferred until later?
